page.title: 12St. Dunstans Church M.Risbo'
page.content: This parish is the oldest in England. St.Dunstans is a C of E Church which was built in the 10th century in the memory of St.Dunstan. The Church can hold over 100 people. In the church there are 6 bells. The Church is made of big stone,sand and flint. In one part of the Church there is a medieval glass put together from the broken pieces found in the Churchyard. The parish communion is celebrated every Sunday at 9.30 am. Evensong and a Sermon takes place.Music and hymns are popular. The first Sunday of each Month there is a celebration of Holy communion at 8 am. This is a service using the old prayer books. Young children have "youngchurch" for ages 4-12. Teenagers have a "Pathfinder Group" also there was "Quest".
